info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 7:13AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Schenectady, southeastern Saratoga, southern Washington and northwestern Bennington Counties through 745 AM EST... At 712 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ballston Spa, or 8 miles southwest of Saratoga Springs, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saratoga Springs, Salem, Ballston Spa, Cambridge, Greenwich, Round Lake, Burnt Hills, Country Knolls, North Ballston Spa, East Glenville, Gates, Malta, Porter, Northumberland, Charlton, Easton, Stillwater, Schuylerville, Rupert and Victory. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 11 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
